description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8p3k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rkse","text":"     We present here a protocol for fractionating crude cellular extracts to prepare membrane and cytosol-enriched fractions and a nuclei-containing insoluble fraction from cultured cells. We deploy this protocol for determining the membrane versus cytosolic distribution of components from LRRK1 and LRRK2 signaling pathways. Wash cells twice with   of ice-cold PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":109,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":191,"style":"sup"}],"key":"63ku1","text":"The optimal quantity of cultured cells to use to achieve an ideal yield will vary dependent on cell type. {"blocks":[{"key":"7m169","text":"Resuspend cells in   of Buffer A by gentle pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"7C41DC40ED8F11ECA4BC75DBD20C3E9E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ocim","text":"Transfer to an 1.5ml Eppendorf tube and incubate   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1icb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"85s5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8D2F5B40ED8F11ECA4BC75DBD20C3E9E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"9116CEA0ED8F11ECA4BC75DBD20C3E9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":65}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a4t79","text":"Note that this is a hypotonic solution and will swell the cells;  . is likely sufficient at this stage.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ccgfv","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"duration":300,"guid":"981F7F30ED8F11ECA4BC75DBD20C3E9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnpr3","text":"Add   of cold Buffer B to the cell suspension.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"A663D730ED8F11ECA4BC75DBD20C3E9E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqium","text":" Using a 25-gauge needle attached to a 1 ml syringe, break the cells by passing the cell suspension through the needle 25 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43ofo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3o8em","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a1728","text":"Breakage can be monitored by transferring a few microliters of the homogenate to a glass slide, covering with a coverslip and visualizing using a low power light microscope used to visualize cultured cells; as few as 6-10 passages may be sufficient. Broken cells will lose their reflective character and small particles of cell components will be readily detected.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f6pr3","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
